page.title: 14ABBOT HOLME FARM
page.content: The farm is situated about a mile from the main Sedbergh to Dent road over a very narrow bridge, so that a portable milk tanker has to be taken to the main road as it is impossible for the milk to be collected from the farm by a tanker. Members of the older generation live with the farmer and his wife. Caring for them involves more work and expense but they are quite happy about this as this is their way of living. Hopes for the future include items relevant to the security of their farm: good summers for haymaking, mild winters so that the animals can survive without a struggle and good health amongst the working members of the family so that their lifestyle may survive. Although their lives require a lot of physical effort the rewards lie within the farm.
